headline: Absolutely the BEST Rich and Creamy Blue Cheese Dressing Ever!
description: This homemade blue cheese dressing has a deliciously creamy, chunky texture, and a nicely balanced flavor to rival anything you can buy at the store.

video.name: How to Make Creamy Blue Cheese Dressing

name: Absolutely the BEST Rich and Creamy Blue Cheese Dressing Ever!
recipeIngredient: salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, mash blue cheese and buttermilk together with a fork until mixture resembles large-curd cottage cheese.
Stir in sour cream, mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar, and garlic powder until well blended. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

review.reviewBody: Very good - I used Kefir (didn't have buttermilk) and added cottage cheese. The second time I made it, I used buttermilk and still added the cottage cheese. In addition, I grated parmesan cheese, chopped it up, and added chives.
Truly is the BEST bleu cheese dressing . . . just add more crumbles, please and thank you. Perfect for buffalo wings and as a salad dressing.

Loved this recipe. Only subs I made were I didn't add any sugar, added 1 garlic clove versus the garlic powder. 1 tsp rice wine vingegar versus the 2 tablespoons and added a bit of worcestershire. It was delicious! Will def make again!

I up the amount of mayonnaise (must be Hellmans or Best Foods) to a half cup and it gives the dressing more body (less runny). I also add about 1/4 tsp worcestershire sauce, a bit of anchovey paste, grated fresh garlic instead of garlic powder, a bit of grated onion (about a Tbsp) and a dash of tabasco. Everyone tells me it is the best blue cheese dressing they've ever had.

Wow, this was great. Made per recipe but did add an extra spoonful or two of crumbled blue cheese. Wonderful, rich, and excellent flavor. Everybody raved about this. With chicken wings or a wedge salad, this is heavenly!

I made this recipe as-is, with the very minor substitution of white moderna (balsamic) vinegar instead of white wine vinegar. It was delicious, rich and thick... until I left it in the refrigerator overnight. After leaving the dressing in the fridge for twelve hours, it became thin, runny, and very unappetizing, to the point that I threw it away. Has anyone else encountered this?

Fantastic! The only change I made is that I swapped the sour cream for Greek yogurt. I had it over chopped iceberg lettuce, not a wedge because that's crazy-talk; who wants a big chunk of lettuce on their plate? Added chopped well-cooked bacon, cherry tomatoes and a sprinkle of green onion. Lots of dressing and a nice hunk of fresh baguette on the side.
I added extra blue cheese to suit our taste. It is my favorite.
Using what I had on hand, substituted for buttermilk cashew milk with a bit of lemon juice, substituted sour cream with labne, used vegan mayo. Result was fantastic. Great, easy recipe.
I used gorgonzola because that is what I had on hand. I also used just a pinch of sugar. It is excellent and would happily spoon it in my mouth if no one was looking.

It has average flavor. I was expecting it to be thicker. I did use lite mayo, and I made my own buttermilk with the milk and vinegar. So not sure what went wrong. I will try a different recipe next time.
love this recipe, I'm Going to top air fried brussel sprouts with air fried chicken
Had to add lemon juice. The vinegar overpowered it. Not bad but I'll use lemon juice instead next time.
I suggest adding a couple dashes of Worchestershire. It gives it that added umame zing.

This is awesome Blue Cheese. First time I have ever made it. So much better than the best store bought. I made a couple of small changes. Added extra blue cheese I like lots. Based on other comments here. Used minimal sweetner. Will never buy store bought again. This is just so simple to make.

Forgot to get blue cheese dressing at the store and didn't want to go back. Made this instead. Make this once and you'll never go back to the store-bought. Incredible flavor without the taste of shelf-stable dressing preservatives. I didn't have buttermilk so "made" some with milk & vinegar. Next time I'll make sure to have buttermilk on hand.
Really good, I double everything but the blue cheese.

Omg!!!!!! I’m so glad I tried this recipe…. The only thing I did differently was instead of salt pepper and garlic I added Sazon total complete seasoning and a pinch of salt…this taste soooooooo goood…..definitely going to be my go to dressing….taste so goood…I made mines in a mason jar so all I would have to do is mix and put in refrigerator…Sooooo tasty

I think this will be delicious, but waiting for the chilled version and my wing-eating son for the final verdict! Did omit the sugar, reduced vinegar to 1 t of white distilled (out of white wine variety) and meant to add a sprinkle of cayenne pepper, but ended up with about 1/4-1/2 t. Hoping it’ll be ok, there is a warmth to it I think my son will appreciate!

Hated the sugar in it, to sweet and I used half what the recipe called for. Left the garlic powder out because it taste artificial to me but using fresh garlic would have been all wrong. Maybe I need a different blue cheese and a dash of garlic powder. I will skip the sugar completely and give it one more shot.

So based upon what other Cooks were saying I adjusted the sugar and I used rice vinegar instead of white wine vinegar the recipe by and large is a really good recipe the ingredients are easy to get if you don't have them they're inexpensive you can adjust the salt and pepper the vinegar as well as everything else to your taste so it's a great basic recipe that invites any subtle change thank you thank you
Great recipe. I followed everything...and added a tsp. of worcestershire sauce (something I used from another recipe). Delicious. Just got asked again to make my dressing for a wedge salad. Thanks!
I omitted the Mayo and used whole milk with vinegar instead of buttermilk. Added some chives too. Used for a wedge salad and was extremely good

This is very easy and very good. I substituted red wine vinegar for the white wine vinegar because that is what I had on hand. Otherwise I went right by the recipe. I’ve made it three times now and my family and I love it. I pour it over an iceberg wedge with bacon and diced tomatoes.
So good, so easy to make. I'll be making this a lot.
Perfect! Didn't have buttermilk but used half&half and it is "oh, wow" yummy!
I left out the salt and buttermilk, but it was still really good.

This recipe is very good!! I usually add some Worcester and lemon. Juice, but followed this recipe just as it was without adding any extras. Also just the right amount for a meal without having any leftovers. ??

Being a foodie.. let me tell ya.. TOP NOTCH!
and not really wanting to confess ... a bit overweight now. So.. I swiped the buttermilk for non-fat greek yogurt, and reduced the amount of Mayo and sour cream. and that is the ONLY way folks I will eat the dredging & PlaneJane Vegetable, my friend the Lettuce

Agree with author this is THE BEST CREAMY BLUE CHEESE DRESSING! After making and loving it about 20 times with regular white vinegar I used the white wine vinegar it calls for... even better. I’ve tried it without the sugar. With more garlic seasoning. With a like lemon juice. But the original recipe is phenomenal if you enjoy blue cheese. Many people I’ve made it for also love it.
Absolutely delish. I was eating it out of the jar! Made per recipe but omitted the sugar (just personal preference). Used Smokey Blue from Rogue Creamery in Oregon. So, so good!
I'm pretty picky when it comes to Blue Cheese dressing, so I tried this recipe . This was awesome! I like blue cheese so I added just a few more crumbles. You will not be disappointed.

Delicious! I used Greek yogurt instead of sour cream, milk, vinegar ( instead of buttermilk),a dash of mustard powder. Basically doubled the recipe and used an immersion blender to mix. Six ounces of blue cheese reserving some so it is chunky!

This truly is amazing! The recipe is simple, and you don't have to be too precise! I never had made blue cheese before, but now I know how to make it without a recipe, because it is so easy to remember. Highlight of my Superbowl snacks.
Excellent......quick and easy! Just like the Capital Grill
Super easy & super yummy! Wish I didn't have to purchase a whole quart of buttermilk for the 3 tablespoons that I needed for this recipe.
Easy and delicious. I didn’t have buttermilk so I just used regular milk with vinegar.
Loved this taste! Thanks for sharing.

I made this according to the recipe and it's perfect. I like the fact that it can be used immediately and that it doesn't make too much that would go to waste (as we normally have a lighter dressing).
Absolutely yummy. Best blue cheese dressing I’ve had. No changes at all. Perfect the way it is
Def does need to sit a bit for the flavors to meld. I quadrupled it; for quick reference:
Perfect ! Made buttermilk with milk and vinegar
Really good! It has a very fresh taste. It is creamy without being heavy. Not tasting all the preservatives and such one finds in bottled dressing makes this dressing the best.
I've made quite a few times now,ABSOLUTELY the best out there!!Wouldn't change a thing!
Made this tonight to go eith grilled steak, baked potatoes on grill and fresh salad from garden. Wow!!! Truly amazing. i made my own buttermilk from milk and vinegar. Thanks!
This is the Cook’s Illustrated recipe. The flavor is good but it is still too thin for my taste.
Used Danish blue, heavy cream instead of buttermilk, and yogurt instead of sour cream because it was what I had available.

Amazing dressing! I added one clove crushed garlic, 4 more Tbs buttermilk, and an extra Tbs of sour cream. So hard to find good blue cheese dressing. I will add more blue cheese next time as we love the chunk ??
Yummy! Is there more? were comments from my guests! Great for salad wedge, also for snacking with veggies.
Absolutely fantastic just the way it is. Thanks for sharing!

Tastes amazing! I gave it four stars because its not as thick as i expected. HOWEVER, I did substitute buttermilk for a homemade version of milk + the white wine vinegar. Also, I omitted the sugar and love the flavor it has already. Hopefully it will thicken up a little as it chills :)

Not bad, I ommitted the salt enirely and substituted approximately a 3rd cup heavy cream blended with a teaspoon of lemon juice and let sit for 15 minutes. Nice consistency for a salad dressing. I paired it up with oven roasted chicken wings. It was good.
I used white vinegar because I didn't have any white wine vinegar. Still had a great flavor!
This turned out really well. I substituted whole milk with vinegar for buttermilk and had no complaints. Sets slightly in fridge and will flow well once you set it out. Great for buffalo wings.

This was my first time making blue cheese dressing. MUCH better than the store-bought stuff. My slight changes to this recipe were that I halved it (just two of us eating) and used Splenda instead of sugar. Then, I added much more garlic powder because I love garlic and a splash of fresh lemon juice. This was delicious on a BLTA salad I made and I won't be buying the store-bought dressing again!

I have made this dressing over and over again and it is the best blue cheese dressing my husband and I have ever had!! We want to just eat it by the bowlful! I do not make any changes. I highly recommend it to anyone who wants an amazing blue cheese dressing with no additives, real ingredients and incredible flavor.

I will definitely make this again. I love funky tangy blue cheese dressing so this is missing just a little something for me, but it is delicious regardless. I'll experiment, but this is a great base!

I made this and doubled the recipe and it came out great! I cooked up some extra crispy bacon as well, blotted off the grease, then put it in my nutribullet and pulsed it three times and added it for an extra punch. Probably the best unhealthy salad dressing i've ever had!
Outstanding recipe! Using for salad, celery sticks, chicken wings, etc. No comparison to store bought / bottled dressings!
This is a great recipe, I did double the garlic powder and used Swerve sweetener for our Keto diet. Delicious

I love it so much it is so good 
but the only problem is that I didn't
have sour cream on hand so it 
wasn't as good as I imagined lol
Excellent blue cheese...will never buy another from the store. I used heavy whipping cream instead of buttermilk and added extra garlic and no salt. This stuff is amazing!!
Easy to follow recipe & was enjoyed by all; I wouldn’t change anything.

I made this recipe to put over iceberg lettuce wedges.
I followed the recipe almost exactly, the only change I made was to add fresh crushed garlic instead of powder. It was delicious and I believe the white wine vinegar with its clean, crisp taste is what really makes it. My husband actually added more to his wedge and he is not a dressing guy. Thank you!
I’ve made this now several times, it’s excellent as is, but if you want to kick it up a notch add some fresh or dried dill, let sit overnight in fridge.... can’t be beat, thank you!!
Consistency is WAY OFF. Add twice the mayo to sour cream if you're going to use white vinegar, which I would suggest. Bland, at best. I would suggest a small amount of garlic powder and some salt.
Made as written and it was delicious. Perfection on a salad!
It has become a family favorie

I couldn’t justify spending $6 for a manufactured blue cheese dressing when we rarely consume all the dressing before the expiry date (despite all the additives). All recipes came through again! This recipe is simple, easy and tasty thank you for sharing. Also I really appreciate the ability to easily adjust the serving size to accommodate changes in the amount I ‘d like to make. Such a cool feature... no more waste.
Too sweet - not tangy enough. Definitely needs more Bleu cheese or more vinegar. Next time I'll use less sugar.
I used half and half. It is the best blue cheese dressing I ever had at home. Definitely a staple now
I have made it many times. My family and friends love it!

Delicious! I will certainly be making this again!

Made as-is, I have to give it three stars. There was just something that was missing flavor-wise. So, I reviewed the ingredients from several different blue cheese dressing recipes and combined a few things here and there. After that, it was delicious! Everyone that has tasted the modified version asks for the recipe. Great for salads and wings! I've even used it as a chip and veggie dip! With the modifications, I now have a keeper recipe that I've made multiple times. Thanks for the base recipe.

After chilling it's perfect. Thick and creamy, better than any restaurant I have tasted.
Easy and delicious. Try smoked blue cheese...you won't be sorry.
Great, tangy and delicious!
Great, tangy and delicious!
Best dressing I have had in years!!
Excellent! Added a bit more buttermilk!
I’ve been making this for years, it’s excellent. I do make a few adjustments. Reduce the amount of vinegar and add cayenne pepper to taste and a few dashes of Worcestershire.
pretty tasty
This dressing is awesome. I used 1 t. Vinegar and 1 t. White wine since I had no white wine vinegar. It tasted great when made and only got better in the fridge.

This is absolutely delicious. I didn't have white wine vinegar so used apple cider, only about half the recommended amount. Mashed the bleu cheese and ingredients per the directions, then put chunks in it before refrigerating. Fantastic.
I have made this many times. It is delicious and easy to do. I love it!
Amazing!!!
Perfect as is! Excellent flavor and consistency. Makes me not want to buy the store stuff anymore! Thanks for the easy recipe!
The blue cheese I used was a little sweet, so I left the sugar out. It was perfect. I suggest adding the sugar to taste at the end.
Simple yet incredibly delicious. This recipe lives up to its name. Make the night before serving to allow the flavours to fuse while in the fridge. Will make again.
This is the best blue cheese dressing ever and it's so easy to make. I double the recipe every time because we eat it so quickly.
This is the best blue cheese dressing ever and it's so easy to make. I double the recipe every time because we eat it so quickly.

Great recipe. I didn't have buttermilk so I mixed milk with plain vinegar and a little white wine and let it thicken. Then I mashed in blue cheese followed by approx 3 tbsp mayo and sour cream. No need to measure ingredients. Then salt ,pepper, garlic powder.I forgot to add sugar, probably doesnt matter. Let it chill for about 30 mins. Absolutely delicious!
Easy and AMAZING!
Truly the best blue cheese dressing I've ever made.
A great base recipe for making a fresh blue cheese salad dressing
